tit.j: 嵐寛寿郎プロダクション

sen.j: 嵐寛寿郎プロダクション（あらしかんじゅうろう-、1928年4月 設立 - 1929年2月 第1期解散 / 1931年8月 第2期設立 - 1937年 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Arashi Kanjuro Production (established April 1928-first disbandment in February 1929, second establishment in August 1931-disbandment in 1937) was a film firm that once existed in Kyoto city.
Arashi Kanjuro Productions (established April 1928, disbanded in February 1929, established again in August 1931 and then disbanded in 1937) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; fixed description in parenthesis to read more naturally; firm > company; that once existed > located; Kyoto city > Kyoto
sen.e: Arashi Kanjuro Productions (established April 1928, disbanded in February 1929, established again in August 1931 and then disbanded in 1937) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）4月にマキノ・プロダクションを片岡千恵蔵らとともに脱退したスター俳優嵐寛寿郎が設立したスタープロダクションであり、貸しスタジオの双ヶ丘撮影所で5本のサイレント映画を製作した「第1期」と、1931年（昭和6年）ふたたび同地に撮影所を持ったのちに太秦へと移転した「第2期」がある。
sen.e: It was the Star Production established by actor Kanjuro ARASHI, who disbanded along with Chiezo KATAOKA from Makino Production in April 1928, and there was the 'First Period' that produced five silent films created at rental Narabigaoka Studio and the 'Second Period' when it moved to Uzumasa after regaining the studio in same location in 1931.

Established by the actor named Kanjuro ARASHI, who resigned from Makino Productions along with Chiezo KATAOKA in April of 1928, it had a "First Period" where it produced five silent films shot at the rentable Narabigaoka Studio, and a "Second Period" when it moved to Uzumasa after regaining the studio in the same location in 1931.
sen.cmt: fixed awkward wording and grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Established by the actor named Kanjuro ARASHI, who resigned from Makino Productions along with Chiezo KATAOKA in April of 1928, it had a 'First Period' where it produced five silent films shot at the rentable Narabigaoka Studio, and a 'Second Period' when it moved to Uzumasa after regaining the studio in the same location in 1931.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 70本以上の作品を生み出し、また山中貞雄を映画監督としてデビューさせたことでも知られる。
sen.e: It produced over seventy works and also known for debuting Sadao YAMANAKA as the film director.
It produced over seventy works and was known for debuting Sadao YAMANAKA as a film director.
sen.cmt: eliminated "also"; the film director > a film director
sen.e: It produced over seventy works and was known for debuting Sadao YAMANAKA as a film director.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 略称寛プロ（かん-）。
sen.e: Its abbreviation was Kan Pro.
It was commonly referred to as "Kan Pro."
sen.cmt: added quotation marks; changed to read more consistently with other similar articles
sen.e: It was commonly referred to as "Kan Pro."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）3月、マキノ・プロダクションに入社し、牧野省三の命名によって嵐和歌太夫から「嵐長三郎」に改名した嵐寛寿郎は、生涯の当たり役となる「鞍馬天狗」の役で『鞍馬天狗異聞 角兵衛獅子』をもって華々しい映画デビューとなった。
sen.e: Kanjuro ARASHI was given the name, 'Chozaburo ARASHI,' by Shozo MAKINO from Wakadayu ARASHI (嵐和歌太夫) after entering Makino Production in March 1927, and made a flamboyant film debut with the life long role of 'Kurama Tengu' (tengu (humanoid monster with long nose and crow wings) of Mt. Kurama) in "Kuramatengu-ibun Kakubeejishi."
sen.cmt: 嵐和歌太夫→Wakadayu ARASHI[定訳不明]
sen.e: After entering Makino Productions in March of 1927, Kanjuro ARASHI changed his name from Wakadayu ARASHI to 'Chozaburo ARASHI,' given to him by Shozo MAKINO, and made a flamboyant film debut with the life-long role of 'Kurama Tengu' (a humanoid monster with a long nose and crow wings that lived on Mt. Kurama) in "Kuramatengu-ibun Kakubeejishi."
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: After entering Makino Productions in March of 1927, Kanjuro ARASHI changed his name from Wakadayu ARASHI to 'Chozaburo ARASHI,' given to him by Shozo MAKINO, and made a flamboyant film debut with the life-long role of 'Kurama Tengu' (a humanoid monster with a long nose and crow wings that lived on Mt. Kurama) in "Kuramatengu-ibun Kakubeejishi."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: わずか1年の間に28本（25本）もの映画に出演したが、翌1928年（昭和3年）4月に同社を退社、名も「嵐寛寿郎」と改めて、設立したのがこの「嵐寛寿郎プロダクション」（寛プロ）である。
sen.e: He appeared in twenty eight (twenty five) films, but quit the same company in the following April 1928, also changed the name to 'Kanjuro ARASHI,' and established this 'Arashi Kanjuro Production' (Kan Pro).
He appeared in twenty eight (twenty five) films, but resigned from Makino in April of 1928, changed his name to 'Kanjuro ARASHI,' and established 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' (Kan Pro).
sen.cmt: quit the same company > resigned from Makino; in the following April 1928 > in April of 1928; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He appeared in twenty eight (twenty five) films, but resigned from Makino in April of 1928, changed his name to 'Kanjuro ARASHI,' and established 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' (Kan Pro).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同時期に片岡千恵蔵、山口俊雄 (新派俳優)、中根龍太郎、市川小文治らスター俳優がマキノを退社し、それぞれが設立したプロダクションと寛プロを含めた5社をもって「日本映画プロダクション連盟」を設立した。
sen.e: The actors from Star Production such as Chiezo KATAOKA, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (new actor), Ryutaro NAKANE, and Kobunji ICHIKAWA quit Makino to establish 'Japanese Film Production Association' with five companies consisting of companies each established and Kan Pro and used together a 'Japan Cinema Studio' in Narabigaoka, Kyoto rented out by Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzo TANAKA to start the film production.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処設立、→設立した。
sen.e: Other actors working at Makino Productions, such as Chiezo KATAOKA, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (a new school actor), Ryutaro NAKANE and Kobunji ICHIKAWA also resigned from Makino to establish their own productions and formed the 'Japan Film Production Association.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処split this sentence since it ran on too long to be natural; (new actor) > (a new school actor); fixed to read more understandably; to establish 'Japanese Film Production Association' > to establish their own productions and formed the 'Japan Film Production Association'
sen.e: Other actors working at Makino Productions, such as Chiezo KATAOKA, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (a new school actor), Ryutaro NAKANE and Kobunji ICHIKAWA also resigned from Makino to establish their own productions and formed the 'Japan Film Production Association.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、マキノを退社した河合広始と田中十三が建設した京都・双ヶ丘の貸しスタジオ「日本キネマ撮影所」（双ヶ丘撮影所）を共同で使用し、製作を開始した。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処added そして、
sen.e: The association consisted of five separately established companies including Kan Pro and used the rentable 'Japan Cinema Studio' in Narabigaoka, Kyoto owned by Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzo TANAKA to start producing films.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処fixed grammar
sen.e: The association consisted of five separately established companies including Kan Pro and used the rentable 'Japan Cinema Studio' in Narabigaoka, Kyoto owned by Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzo TANAKA to start producing films.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またそれに先立つ同年4月、配給業者による中間搾取のない製作と興行の直結を訴える山崎徳次郎が「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」を結成、5つのスタープロダクションを製作費と興行の面で支えることとなった。
sen.e: Tokujiro YAMAZAKI, who called out for the direct no middle exploitation of the production and the performance, established the 'Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha' (Headquarters of Eiga Haikyu for association of masters of movie theaters in Japan) and started to support five firms with movie stars, its production fee, and the show.

Tokujiro YAMAZAKI made an appeal to eliminate the exploitation of productions and performances by establishing "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) and began supporting the five production companies' production fees and promotions.
sen.cmt: changed description for "Kanshu Katsudo…"; ' > "; eliminated "movie stars"; changed "and the show" to "promotions" for 興行;
sen.e: Tokujiro YAMAZAKI made an appeal to eliminate the exploitation of productions and performances by establishing 'Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha' (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) and began supporting the five production companies' production fees and promotions.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 寛プロ設立第1作はやはり『鞍馬天狗』、「館主連盟」の主要館である神戸市の「菊水館」を中心に同年7月12日に公開された。
sen.e: The first work of Kan Pro was "Kurama Tengu" released in 'Kikusuikan Theater' in Kobe city, which was the main hall of 'movie theater association,' on July 2 of the same year.
The first work produced by Kan Pro was "Kurama Tengu," released in 'Kikusuikan Theater' in Kobe, which was the main hall of the Theater Owner's Association, on July 2 of the same year.
sen.cmt: changed 'movie theater association' to "Theater Owner's Association" for consistency
sen.e: The first work produced by Kan Pro was "Kurama Tengu," released in 'Kikusuikan Theater' in Kobe, which was the main hall of the Theater Owner's Association, on July 2 of the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし「館主連盟」が7月末には瓦解、5つのプロダクションのうち3つが解散を余儀なくされていく。
sen.e: However, 'movie theater association' collapsed at the end of July and three out of five production firms had to disband.
However, the association collapsed at the end of July and three out of the five production companies were forced to disband.
sen.cmt: changed 'movie theater association' to "the association"; fixed grammar
sen.e: However, the association collapsed at the end of July and three out of the five production companies were forced to disband.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのなかで片岡千恵蔵プロダクションと「寛プロ」だけが製作をつづけたが、設立第5作『鬼神の血煙』をもって解散、1929年（昭和4年）2月、嵐寛寿郎は東亜キネマ京都撮影所（等持院撮影所）にスター級幹部俳優として迎えられることとなった。
sen.e: Only Chiezo Production and 'Kan Pro' continued the production, but Kan Pro disbanded with the "Kishin no chikemuri," which was the fifth work since the establishment and Kanjuro ARASHI was invited to Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (Tojiin Studio) in February 1929 as the actor with an administrative authority similar to the one in Star Production.

Chiezo Productions and 'Kan Pro' continued with their productions, but Kan Pro disbanded after its fifth work called "Kishin no Chikemuri" and Kanjuro ARASHI was invited to Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (Tojiin Studio) in February of 1929 as an actor with administrative authority similar to one in a star production.
sen.cmt: fixed awkward working and grammar to read more naturally; made "star production" lowercase
sen.e: Chiezo Productions and 'Kan Pro' continued with their productions, but Kan Pro disbanded after its fifth work called "Kishin no Chikemuri" and Kanjuro ARASHI was invited to Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (Tojiin Studio) in February of 1929 as an actor with administrative authority similar to one in a star production.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）5月、ふたたび「嵐寛寿郎プロダクション」名義、東亜キネマ配給で嵐の主演作が発表され始める。
sen.e: The works with a central role played by Arashi was released again with the name 'Arashi Kanjuro Production' in May 1931 provided by Toa Kinema (cinema).
Works with Arashi playing a central role were once again being released with the name 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' provided by Toa Kinema in May of 1931.
sen.cmt: eliminated "The"; Production > Productions; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Works with Arashi playing a central role were once again being released with the name 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' provided by Toa Kinema in May of 1931.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 第1作は『都一番風流男』で、4作がこのくくりで公開されたのちに、同年8月、東亜キネマ京都撮影所長の高村正次とともに嵐は東亜を退社した。
sen.e: The first work was "Miyako ichiban furyu otoko" (the most refined man in the capital) and four works was produced with that ending name, and Arashi quit Toa with Masatsugu TAKAMURA of the department head of Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio, to establish the second Period 'Kan Pro,' and was released along with the work provided by Shinko Cinema regrouped from Teikoku kinema engei kabushiki gaisha (Imperial Cinema Entertainment Co.) Ltd.).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処東亜を退社、→東亜を退社した。
sen.e: After the first work called "Miyako Ichiban Furyu Otoko" (The Most Refined Man in the Capital) as well as four other works with the same name were released, Arashi resigned from Toa with the department head of Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio named Masatsugu TAKAMURA in August of 1931.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処capitalized movie title; added date missing from translation 1; fixed grammar
sen.e: After the first work called "Miyako Ichiban Furyu Otoko" (The Most Refined Man in the Capital) as well as four other works with the same name were released, Arashi resigned from Toa with the department head of Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio named Masatsugu TAKAMURA in August of 1931.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして第2期「寛プロ」が設立され、同年9月に帝国キネマから改組された新興キネマとの提携のもと、作品が発表される。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処added そして
sen.e: Arashi then established the second period of 'Kan Pro' and in September of 1931 announced a production made in a partnership with Shinko Kinema which had regrouped from Teikoku Kinema (Imperial Cinema Entertainment Co. Ltd.).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処I could not understand the end of translation 1, so I made my own and added the date
sen.e: Arashi then established the second period of 'Kan Pro' and in September of 1931 announced a production made in a partnership with Shinko Kinema which had regrouped from Teikoku Kinema (Imperial Cinema Entertainment Co. Ltd.).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嵐は俳優・スタッフを含めた50数名を率いて、双ヶ丘撮影所に拠点を構えた。
sen.e: Arashi led fifty members including actors and staff and made Narabigaoka Studio as a base.
Arashi led fifty members, including actors and staff, and established Narabigaoka Studio as a base.
sen.cmt: added comma after "members" and "staff"; made > established
sen.e: Arashi led fifty members, including actors and staff, and established Narabigaoka Studio as a base.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 第2期「寛プロ」作品は、新興キネマのドル箱となり、多くの作品を製作した。
sen.e: The second period 'Kan Pro' works provided income source for the Shinko Cinema and produced many works.
Kan Pro' produced many works during its second period providing income for Shinko Kinema.
sen.cmt: changed "Cinema" to "Kinema" for consistency; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Kan Pro' produced many works during its second period providing income for Shinko Kinema.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年）には撮影所を拡張、さらに1935年（昭和10年）4月には太秦に新撮影所を建設、「嵐寛寿郎プロダクション太秦撮影所」として移転した。
sen.e: Film studio was expanded in 1933, built new shooting studio in Uzumasa in April 1935 to transfer as the 'Arashi Kanjuro Production Uzumasa Studio.'
The film studio was expanded in 1933, then in April of 1935 a new studio was built in Uzumasa and turned into 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' Uzumasa Studio.'
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The film studio was expanded in 1933, then in April of 1935 a new studio was built in Uzumasa and turned into 'Arashi Kanjuro Productions' Uzumasa Studio.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ところが、1936年（昭和11年）になると松竹の専務取締役に就任した城戸四郎が新興キネマの製作指揮を行うようになり、提携しているスタープロダクションとの解約を推進した。
sen.e: However, Shiro KIDO that became the CEO of Shochiku directed the production of Shinko Cinema in 1936, and abandoned the contract with the Star Production.
However, Shiro KIDO, who became the CEO of Shochiku and directed the productions of Shinko Kinema in 1936, abandoned the contract with the Star Production.
sen.cmt: that became > who became; added comma after "KIDO"; added "and" after "Shochiku"; changed "Cinema" to "Kinema" for consistency; I am unclear what "Star Production" is referring to here
sen.e: However, Shiro KIDO, who became the CEO of Shochiku and directed the productions of Shinko Kinema in 1936, abandoned the contract with the Star Production.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年12月には、阪東妻三郎プロダクション、高田稔プロダクションが解散を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: Bando Tsumasaburo Production and Takada Minoru Production had to disband in December of the same year, and the second Period 'Kan Pro' disbanded on August 6 of the following July 29, 1937 with the final work of "Gozonji Kuramatengu Senryo Koban" and passed all 110 staffs to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio where Masaichi NAGATA worked as a department head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処余儀なくされ、→余儀なくされた。
sen.e: Bando Tsumasaburo Productions and Takada Minoru Productions were forced to disband in December of 1935.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処Production > Productions; had to > were forced to; of the same year > of 1935; Split this sentence since this part seemed to make it a run-on
sen.e: Bando Tsumasaburo Productions and Takada Minoru Productions were forced to disband in December of 1935.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ついに翌1937年（昭和12年）、7月29日に公開された『御存知鞍馬天狗 千両小判』を最終作として、同年8月6日、第2期「寛プロ」は解散、110数名におよぶ全従業員を、永田雅一が所長をつとめる新興キネマ京都撮影所に預けることとなった。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The second period 'Kan Pro' eventually disbanded on August 6, 1937 after releasing its final production on July 29, 1937 called "Gozonji Kuramatengu Senryo Koban," passing all 110 of its staff members to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio where Masaichi NAGATA worked as department head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The second period 'Kan Pro' eventually disbanded on August 6, 1937 after releasing its final production on July 29, 1937 called "Gozonji Kuramatengu Senryo Koban," passing all 110 of its staff members to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio where Masaichi NAGATA worked as department head.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嵐は浪人の身となり、自由を謳歌したのち、1938年（昭和13年）に日活撮影所に入社した。
sen.e: Arashi became the ronin (leaderless), enjoyed freedom, before being hired at Nikkatsu Studio in 1938.
Arashi became independent and enjoyed his freedom until he was hired at Nikkatsu Studio in 1938.
sen.cmt: changed "ronin (leaderless)" to "became independent"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Arashi became independent and enjoyed his freedom until he was hired at Nikkatsu Studio in 1938.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
